intro: Crotalaria heterotricha, commonly known as the hairy crotalaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy foliage, which give it its common name. It grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant has a shallow root system and is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
